p.k: Marin Alsop conducts the Britten-Pears Orchestra in a performance of Maurice Ravel's 'Ma mere l'Oye' (Mother Goose). This performance took place at Snape Maltings Concert Hall, Snape Bridge in the UK in 2017.
p.d: Marin Alsop conducts the Britten-Pears Orchestra in a performance of Maurice Ravel's 'Ma mere l'Oye' (Mother Goose). This performance took place at Snape Maltings Concert Hall, Snape Bridge in the UK in 2017. This five-part orchestral suite was originally as a piano duet in 1910, but the composer orchestrated the work the year after. Ravel originally composed the work as a piano duet for the two children of Polish sculptor Gobeski and dedicated the work for four hands to the children.
